4.2.1.1. mime_multipart.multipart¶

class mime_multipart.multipart(fields, files, chunk_size=1048576)¶

Generate a MIME Multipart document based on a set of files and fields.

The document can either be automatically posted to a web server with HTTP POST, retrieved in chunks using iteration or retrieved in chunks using the read interface.

__init__(fields, files, chunk_size=1048576)¶

Constructor for multipart. :param fields: sequence of (name, value) elements for regular form fields :type fields: [(string, string), ] :param files: sequence of (name, filename, value) elements for data to be

uploaded as files.
Parameters:
  • chunk_size (integer) – Max number of bytes to return in a single iteration. If chunk_size is set lower than a few hundred bytes, chunks that include MMP headers and boundaries may exceed this number.
Returns:

None

Methods

__init__(fields, files, chunk_size=1048576)

Constructor for multipart. :param fields: sequence of (name, value) elements for regular form fields :type fields: [(string, string), ] :param files: sequence of (name, filename, value) elements for data to be

uploaded as files.
Parameters:
  • chunk_size (integer) – Max number of bytes to return in a single iteration. If chunk_size is set lower than a few hundred bytes, chunks that include MMP headers and boundaries may exceed this number.
Returns:

None
next()¶

Iterate over the multipart object and return the next chunk of MIME Multipart data.

The returned number of bytes will match the chunk_size with which the multipart object was instantiated when chunks of files are returned. When parts of the MIME Multipart structure is returned, the number of bytes returned will be between zero and a few hundred.

Returns:The next chunk of MIME Multipart data.
Returns type:string
read(n=None)¶

Read a chunk of the generated MIME Multipart document.

The returned number of bytes will be equal to n for all chunks but the last one, which will most likely be smaller. When the method returns an empty string, there is no more data to be retrieved.

If n is None, the entire MIME Multipart document is returned.

Parameters:
  • n (integer) – Minimum number of bytes to read.
Returns:

The bytes that were read.
Returns type:

string
reset()¶

Reset the mime_multipart object to its initial state.

This allows the MIME Multipart document to be regenerated from the data with which the multipart object was instantiated.

Returns:None
